Tucson had no idea what was happening to him.  Hydras reply comes as a shoc=
k to the Autobot, as he gives a blank look all of a sudden.  He could not a=
nswer his question without hesitation in his voice.

" As - as far as I kno=
w, I - I...  I - don't think I'm related to him. I deeply admire him, yes, =
but I honestly do not think I'm related to him."

His deeply hidden power o=
f his spark recedes and quickly returns him to his regular height.  He had =
no notion of how to control it, nor had he known what it was.  As it revers=
es, he suddenly feels a good portion of power leave his body, yet, he was n=
ot about to abandon the act of defending himself against Hydras or Rodimus =
for that matter. 

" Power or no power, you've abducted one of my own, and =
turned him into your evil pawn.  No matter the consequence, I will stand my=
 ground and do whatever it takes to rightfully return my leader to his role=
 as the commander of the Autobots.  Even if I have to saccrifice my own spa=
rk to accomplish my mission.  That is why I'm here, not for power, not for =
lust, not for domination.  I'm here because know it or not, someone who was=
 once very close to me, needs my help and I never turn my hand away when a =
fellow comrade is in grave danger.  I'm sure you would do the same for one =
of your own."  

He turns to Rodimus.  

" If I do not succeed this time, I=
 will suffer my defeat honorably.  I will fall many times if I have to.  Bu=
t rest assured Rodimus, when the time is right, and you finally reach out t=
o me, I promise my hand will be there to reach out to you.  And when I do, =
I won't let go. I promise, I will not abandon you or this cause.  As dark a=
s you are now, you may not understand, but hopefully one day, you will."  
=

He then turns back to Hydras.

" All right Hydras, I'll let you decide how=
 you wish to fight.  After all, this is your domain, and I am an intruder h=
ere. " 

Deep down Tucson wished he could avoid a scuffle.  He wished he co=
uld just bargain with Hydras but after seeing that he was a combination of =
Megatron and Galvatron, that made for a different situation all together.  =
To him, Decepticons were still his enemies.  He was however still taken aba=
ck by Hydra's question.  While he looks to Hydras he thinks to himself once=
 more.

" Me? Related to Optimus Prime?"

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <a=
irly2002@...> wrote:
>
> Hydras:
> Hydras stood up slowly in a non treaten =
way, and camly walked a round the Scene watching the battle when Tucson loo=
ked like more like Optimus and he said "Yesss, this will be like the old go=
od times... tell me Scrappling, what's your relation with My old Pal, Optim=
us Prime?" said  hydras with a remarcable ironic mocking tone in the word p=
al 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> From: Super Cyclonus 
> Sent: Friday, February 19, 2010 1=
1:24 AM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/Bla=
ckFortress
> 
> 
>   
> The battle was not what it seemed . . . 
>  
> The =
punch Rodimus had thrown, the one that was so easily blocked by Tuscon, wou=
ld have shocked Rodimus had it landed. He would have been glad to be rid of=
 this annoyance, yes, but it would have been somewhat disappointing as well=
. 
>  
> So when Rodimus was spun around by Tuscon, the Autobot may have mi=
ssed the wicked smile on his face, When Tuscon tried to ram Rodimus into a =
wall, he may not have noticed that the sound of crunching metal was not Rod=
imus' but the reinrorced wall shearing and tearing under the force of the a=
ssault. It was not the sound of Rodimkus' defeat that resonated through the=
 room, but it was something else!
>  
> Many of the same teachers that had =
instructed Tuscon had trained a young Hot Rod as well -  Jazz, Prowl, Brawn=
, Kup, even Optimus himself! And while Rodimus no longer clearly remembered=
 all these ones and what they had meant to him, thier lessons were still gr=
ound into him, and his reflexes that had been honed over the years of battl=
e! 
>  
> Also, this was no young Hot Rod that stood there before them, but=
 a figure shapped by the energy of the matrix into a character of leadershi=
p, power and ability. He no longer had access to the knowledge and wisdom o=
f the matrix, the energy having been stripped from him. But that power that=
 had been imparted was still there, reconfigured by the power of the predac=
on shell program! He was faster, stronger and far more durable then Hot Rod=
 ever was, he was DARK RODIMUS!
>  
> So when Rodimus hit the wall it was n=
ot truely pain that he felt, but the elation that a true battle was in the =
making. He felt that charge that all warriors felt when they faced a foe th=
at had some metal! It was an eagerness twisted by Predacon programming into=
 something dark and loathsome. 
>  
> So when he stood and turned around it=
 was not defeat in his stance but derision, "So you fancy yourself to be a =
Prime do you, scrappling?" Rodimus said his tone still mocking as he raised=
 his arm, smiling as his optics glowing with energy, "Well let's see what y=
ou got!" With a thought he fired a blast of plasma energy from his arm moun=
ted cannon at this new incarnation of Tuscon, who for the moment appeared t=
o be posturing for Hydras!
>  
> OOC: Remember, the matrix that is housed w=
ithin Rodimus has no energy of its own, only the housing. It does not have =
the power to reach out and transform anyone, although I do have some ideas.=
 I am not sure if you want to redo your post, or let it go as it stands. 
>=
  
> Preston
> (Cyclonus/Scourge/Dark rodimus)
